description: Point mutations in the helix 44 region of the 16S rRNA rrsB gene of Mycolicibacterium smegmatis can confer resistance to viomycin.

name: mdtN
description: Multidrug resistance efflux pump. Could be involved in resistance to puromycin, acriflavine and tetraphenylarsonium chloride.

name: mdtO
description: Multidrug resistance efflux pump. Could be involved in resistance to puromycin, acriflavine and tetraphenylarsonium chloride.

name: mdtP
description: Multidrug resistance efflux pump. Could be involved in resistance to puromycin, acriflavine and tetraphenylarsonium chloride.

name: emeA
description: A multidrug efflux pump from Enterococcus faecalis. There exist efflux activity of several antimicrobial agents such as DAPI, Hoechst 33342 and acriflavine. Efflux of DAPI via EmeA was strongly inhibited by reserpine.

name: fusB
description: FusB encodes a 2-domain zinc-binding protein that binds the ribosomal translocase EF-G, causing it to dissociate from the ribosome. This action increases the ribosomal turnover rate and confers resistance to fusidic acid. This protein is considered a FusB-type protein.

name: CepS
description: CEPS is a typical class C cephalosporinase found in Aeromonas sobria, first isolated from strain 163a.

name: tcmA
description: Major facilitator superfamily transporter. Resistance to tetracenomycin C by an active tetracenomycin C efflux system which is probably energized by transmembrane electrochemical gradients.

name: SLB-1
description: This enzyme breaks the beta-lactam antibiotic ring open and deactivates the molecule's antibacterial properties.

name: SFB-1
description: This enzyme breaks the beta-lactam antibiotic ring open and deactivates the molecule's antibacterial properties.

name: y56 beta-lactamase
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Yersinia enterocolitica biovar 1A.

name: cepA
description: A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides fragilis producing either low or high levels of the endogenous cephalosporinase activity.

name: Sed-1
description: Sed-1 is a chromosomal-encoded class A beta-lactamase identified in Citrobacter sedlakii.

name: blaF
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Mycolicibacterium fortuitum.

name: RCP-1
description: RCP is a class A beta-lactamase found in Rhodopseudomonas capsulata.

name: EXO-1
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Streptomyces albus G.

name: R39
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Actinomadura R39.

name: LpxA
description: The LpxA gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane.

name: LpxC
description: The LpxC gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane.

name: LpxD
description: The LpxD gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane.

name: eptA
description: PmrC mediates the modification of Lipid A by the addition of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (L-Ara4N) and phosphoethanolamine, resulting in a less negative cell membrane and decreased binding of polymyxin B.

name: ugd
description: PmrE is required for the synthesis and transfer of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) to Lipid A, which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin.

name: PmrF
description: PmrF is required for the synthesis and transfer of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) to Lipid A, which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin. pmrF corresponds to 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.

name: basR
description: Response regulator for Lipid A modification genes; two-component system involved in polymyxin resistance that senses high extracellular Fe(2+).

name: basS
description: Histidine protein kinase sensor Lipid A modification gene; part of a two-component system involved in polymyxin resistance that senses high extracellular Fe(2+).

name: Klebsiella mutant PhoP conferring antibiotic resistance to colistin
description: A mutant phoP activates pmrHFIJKLM expression responsible for L-aminoarabinose synthesis and polymyxin resistance, by way of alteration of negative charge.

name: NmcA
description: NmcA is a class A serine beta-lactamase isolated from Enterobacter cloacae.

name: SHV-190
description: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases, not yet released.

name: SHV-191
description: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases, not yet released.

description: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available.

name: CMY-132
description: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available.

name: CMY-133
description: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available.

name: CMY-134
description: CMY-134 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli. It confers resistance to cephamycin. Detected directly from NCBI and submitted without publication on 07-JUN-2016.

name: ACT-38
description: A class C beta-lactamase from Citrobacter freundii.

name: IMP-49
description: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available.

name: IMP-51
description: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available.

name: VIM-44
description: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available.

name: VIM-45
description: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available.

name: VIM-46
description: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available.

name: NDM-15
description: New Delhi metallo-beta-lactamase-15 variant of NDM-1.

name: NDM-16a
description: New Delhi class B metallo-beta-lactamase-16a variant of NDM-1.

name: NmcR
description: NmcR is a homolog of the LysR regulator found in Enterobacter cloacae that contribute to the regulation of NmcA beta-lactamase.

name: PEDO-1
description: PEDO-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Pedobacter roseus exhibiting resistance to carbapenems.

name: AAC(6')-Ib'
description: AAC(6')-Ib' is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in P. aeruginosa and P. fluorescens.

name: AAC(6')-Iaj
description: AAC(6')-Iaj is a functional acetyltransferase that modifies the amino groups at the 6' positions of aminoglycosides and contributes to aminoglycoside resistance of P. aeruginosa.

name: TriABC-OpmH
description: TriABC-OpmH is a triclosan-specific efflux pump expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. TriABC is the only P. aeruginosa resistance nodulation cell division (RND) pump which contains two membrane fusion proteins, TriA and TriB, and both are required for efflux pump function. TriABC associated with OpmH assemble a functional triclosan efflux pump.

name: TriA
description: TriA is a membrane protein that is fused to TriB and both are required for the triclosan efflux pump function of TriABC-OpmH in P. aeruginosa.

name: TriB
description: TriB is a membrane protein that is fused to TriA and both are required for the triclosan efflux pump function of TriABC-OpmH in P. aeruginosa.

name: TriC
description: TriC is a resistance nodulation cell division (RND) transporter that is a part of TriABC-OpmH, a triclosan-specific efflux protein.

name: OpmH
description: OpmH is an outer membrane efflux protein required for triclosan-specific efflux pump function.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation of Pseudomonas aeruginosa gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and gyrA. Thus, conferring resistance.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa parE conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in Pseudomonas aeruginosa parE resulting in sensitivity to fluoroquinolones (ciprofloxacin). In combination with a gyrase mutation (gyrA or gyrB), it confers a high level of resistance to ciprofloxacin.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa oprD with mutation conferring resistance to imipenem
description: oprD is an outer membrane porin which facilitates the uptake of basic amino acids and imipenem in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PvrR
description: PvrR is a response regulator that controls the conversion between antibiotic-resistant and antibiotic-susceptible forms of Pseudomonas aeruginosa biofilms through porin deletion/gene absence.

name: MCR-1.1
description: MCR-1 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase that interferes with binding of colistin to the cell membrane via addition of phosphoethanolamine to lipid A, resulting reduction in negative charge of the cell membrane.

name: MexJK-OpmH
description: MexJK-OpmH is a triclosan efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexJ is the membrane fusion protein, MexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter, and OpmH is the outer membrane efflux protein. MexJK is constitutively expressed in mexL mutants.

name: MexJ
description: MexJ is the membrane fusion protein of the MexJK multidrug efflux protein.

name: MexK
description: MexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter in the MexJK multidrug efflux protein.

name: MexJK-OprM
description: MexJK-OprM is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexJ is the membrane fusion protein, MexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter, and OprM is the outer membrane factor protein.

name: MexPQ-OpmE
description: MexPQ-OpmE multidrug efflux pump expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexP is the membrane fusion protein; MexQ is the inner membrane transporter; and OpmE is the outer membrane channel.

name: mexP
description: MexP is the membrane fusion protein of the MexPQ-OpmE multidrug efflux complex.

name: mexQ
description: MexQ is the inner membrane transporter of the multidrug efflux pump MexPQ-OpmE.

name: opmE
description: opmE is an outer membrane factor protein that is part of the multidrug efflux pump MexPQ-OpmE.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa gyrA and parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in Pseudomonas aeruginosa parC resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance also requiring a gyrA mutation.

name: MexMN-OprM
description: MexMN-OprM is a multidrug efflux pump expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexM is the membrane fusion protein; MexN is the inner membrane transporter; and OprM is the outer membrane channel.

name: mexM
description: mexM is the membrane fusion protein of the MexMN-OprM multidrug efflux complex.

name: mexN
description: MexN is the inner membrane transporter of the MexMN-OprM multidrug efflux complex.

name: MexZ
description: MexZ is a transcriptional regulator that downregulates the mexXY multidrug transporter operon, which confers to aminoglycoside resistance on Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: MexL
description: MexL is a specific repressor of mexJK transcription and autoregulates its own expression.

name: VEB-1b
description: VEB-1b is a beta-lactamase that is found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: VCC-1
description: VCC-1 is a Class A carbapenemase isolated from Vibrio cholerae and exhibits resistance to penicillins, carbapenems and monobactam antibiotics.

name: PEDO-2
description: PEDO-2 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Pedobacter borealis exhibiting carbapenem resistance.

name: PEDO-3
description: PEDO-3 is a class B1 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Pedobacter kyungheensis exhibiting resistance to carbapenems.

name: CPS-1
description: CPS-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Chyseobacterium piscium exhibiting carbapenem resistance.

name: ESP-1
description: ESP-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Epilithonimonas tenax conferring resistance to carbapenems.

name: MSI-1
description: MSI-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Massilia oculi conferring resistance to carbapenems.

name: MSI-OXA
description: MSI-OXA is an OXA-85-like class D beta lactamase isolated from Massilia oculi.

name: SPG-1
description: SPG-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Sphingomonas sp.

name: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanI
description: This inducible cluster confers high resistance to vancomycin and intermediate resistance to teicoplanin. It achieves this through peptidoglycan restructuring with its VanA ligase homologue, VanI, causing the precursurs to end in D-Ala-D-Lac. The cluster uniquely contains murF, the final enzyme in the synthesis of UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-pentapeptide, the precursor of murein. The VanI gene cluster has been found in chromosomal DNA. Gene orientation: vanSRIWK-murFvanX.

name: vanI
description: VanI is a D-Ala-D-Lac ligase that reduces vancomycin binding affinity, helping to confer vancomycin resistance as part of the VanI resistance gene cluster in Desulfitobacterium spp. and Desulfosporosinus spp.

name: vanW gene in vanI cluster
description: Also known as vanWI, is a vanW variant found in the vanI gene cluster.

name: vanX gene in vanI cluster
description: Also known as vanXI, is a vanX variant found in the vanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster. It is a D-Ala-D-Ala dipeptidase.

name: vanS gene in vanI cluster
description: Also known as vanSI, is a vanS variant found in the vanI gene cluster; it is a histidine kinase.

name: vanK gene in vanI cluster
description: Also known as vanKI, is a peptidoglycan bridge formation protein also known as FemAB that is part of the vanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster.

name: vanR gene in vanI cluster
description: Also known as vanRI, is the regulatory transcriptional activator in the vanSR regulator within the vanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster.

name: Staphylococcus aureus ileS with mutation conferring resistance to mupirocin
description: Point mutations to the isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase (ileS) in Staphylococcus aureus that confer resistance to mupirocin.

name: Bifidobacterium bifidum ileS conferring resistance to mupirocin
description: Bifidobacteria have an intrinsically resistant form of ileS (isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase) that confers resistance to mupirocin.

name: fusD
description: A specific fusidic acid resistance gene conferring intrinsic resistance in the bacteria Staphylococcus saprophyticus. FusD behaves by causing dissociation of EF-G from the ribosome thus counteracting the action of Fusidic acid. It is considered a FusB-type protein.

name: fusC
description: FusC is a fusidic acid resistance gene enabling ribosomal translocase EF-G dissociation from the ribosome that has been detected in Staphylococcus aureus and Staphylococcus intermedius. Its mechanism is believed to be similar to fusB due to its high level of sequence homology. It is considered a FusB-type protein.

name: Staphylococcus aureus fusA with mutation conferring resistance to fusidic acid
description: The mutations to this gene are involved in altering the translation elongation factor G (EF-G) in association with the ribosome to prevent fusidic acid from binding EF-G and preventing translation.

name: Staphylococcus aureus fusE with mutation conferring resistance to fusidic acid
description: The mutations to the rplF gene encoding riboprotein L6 have been shown to cause fusidic acid resistance, demonstrating a potential secondary site of action of the antibiotic that is blocked through these mutations. Several types of mutations have been identified that cause resistance, including SNPs, frameshift mutations and early stop codons.

name: mphE
description: mphE is a macrolide phosphotransferase and resistance gene identified on a plasmid, pRSB105.

name: mphG
description: The mphG gene encodes a macrolide 2'-phosphotransferase found in Photobacterium damselae sharing sequence similarity to mphA in E. coli.

name: vatF
description: vatF is a streptogramin A acetyl transferase gene isolated from the chromosome of Yersinia enterocolitica.

name: mefC
description: mefC is a macrolide efflux gene isolated from a plasmid in Photobacterium damselae.

name: optrA
description: OptrA is a member of the ABC-F protein subfamily that confers resistance to oxazolidinones. The gene encoding the protein was originally isolated from a plasmid in Enterococcus faecalis and Enterococcus faecium.

name: oleC
description: oleC is an ABC transporter isolated from Streptomyces antibioticus and is involved in oleandomycin secretion.

name: salA
description: salA is an ABC-F subfamily protein gene isolated from the chromosome of Mammaliicoccus sciuri conferring resistance to lincosamides and streptogramins.

name: Escherichia coli nfsA mutations conferring resistance to nitrofurantoin
description: nfsA encodes the major oxygen-insesitive nitroreductase in E. coli. The first step of resistance to nitrofurazone is mutation of nfsA.

name: Escherichia coli nfsB with mutation conferring resistance to nitrofurantoin
description: nfsB encodes the minor oxygen-insesitive nitroreductase in E. coli. The first step of resistance to nitrofurazone is mutation of nfsA, while the increased resistance associated with second step mutants is a consequence of nfsB mutation.

name: Enterococcus faecalis cls with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: Cardiolipin synthase (cls) is an inner membrane protein involved in membrane synthesis and phosopholipid metabolism, with mutations to the gene being capable of conferring daptomycin resistance.

name: eatAv
description: eatAv is a mutated form of the wildtype eatA ABC-F subfamily protein isolated from Enterococcus faecium conferring resistance to lincosamides, streptogramin A's and pleuromutilins (LSaP phenotype).

name: lnuE
description: lnuE encodes a lincosamide resistance gene isolated from Streptococcus suis that was truncated by an ISEnfa5-cfr-ISEnfa5 segment insertion. It shares the closest sequence similarity to lnuA.

name: mphM
description: mphM is a chromosomally-encoded macrolide phosphotransferases that inactivate 14-, 15- and 16-membered macrolides.

name: Staphylococcus aureus mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. A point mutation in the putative mprF synthase domain is associated with enhanced expression, increased synthesis and reduced daptomycin surface binding. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Listeria monocytogenes mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Brucella suis mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Clostridium perfringens mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Streptococcus agalactiae mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Escherichia coli murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Overexpression of murA through mutations such as Asp369Asn and Leu370Ile confers fosfomycin resistance. Extensive evidence has shown the significance of C115 mutations in conferring fosfomycin resistance since this residue represents a primary binding site for the antibiotic across many species.

name: Staphylococcus aureus murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Overexpression of murA through mutations confers fosfomycin resistance.

name: Borreliella burgdorferi murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Mutations to the murA enzyme confers resistance to the antibiotic.

name: Mycolicibacterium smegmatis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: Mutations in the Mycolicibacterium smegmatis ndh gene that results in increased resistance to isoniazid.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis variant bovis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: Mutations in the Mycobacterium tuberculosis variant bovis ndh gene that results in increased resistance to isoniazid.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis intrinsic murA conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mycobacterium tuberculosis murA confers intrinsic resistance to fosfomycin. The presence of an aspartic acid residue in place of the critical cysteine at position 117 that enables fosfomycin binding is believed to be responsible for this intrinsic resistance.

name: Chlamydia trachomatis intrinsic murA conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Chlamydia murA confers intrinsic resistance to fosfomycin. The presence of an aspartic acid residue in place of the critical cysteine at position 119 that enables fosfomycin binding is believed to be responsible for this intrinsic resistance.

name: Bacillus subtilis pgsA with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: Point mutations that occur within the Bacillus subtilis pgsA gene resulting in resistance to daptomycin.

name: Campylobacter jejuni gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Campylobacter jejuni is a major bacterial infectious agent associated with gastroenteritis. Quinolone resistance is reportedly conferred by a single C-257-T nucleotide substitution in the gyrA gene.

name: Enterococcus faecium liaF mutant conferring daptomycin resistance
description: liaF is an accessory protein that acts as a negative regulator of liaRS signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis liaS mutant conferring daptomycin resistance
description: liaS is a histidine kinase found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis liaR mutant conferring daptomycin resistance
description: liaR is a response regulator found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: SPM-1
description: Plasmid-mediated SPM metallo-beta-lactamase conferring resistance to carbapenem. Originally isolated from Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Responsible for carbapenem-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa (CRPA) outbreaks in Brazil.

name: Staphylococcus aureus walK with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: walK is the histidine kinase sensor of a two-component regulatory system controlling peptidoglycan metabolism through regulation of the expression of most of the peptidoglycan hydrolase genes. Mutations in the gene have been found that confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii ampC beta-lactamase
description: A class C beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii that confers resistance to piperacillin and cefepime.

name: Enterococcus faecalis YybT with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: YybT has phosphodiesterase activity towards cyclic dinucleotides using a c-di-GMP hydrolyzing phosphodiesterase domain. Mutations to the gene confer resistance to daptomycin.

name: Enterococcus faecalis gdpD with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: gdpD is a glycerolphosphodiesterase whose mutations confer resistance to daptomycin.

name: bcr-1
description: Transmembrane protein which expels bicyclomycin from the cell, leading to bicyclomycin resistance. Identified in Pseudomonas aeruginosa strains responsible for outbreaks in Brazil, often appearing with blaSPM-1, another bicyclomycin resistance gene.

name: Staphylococcus aureus agrA with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: agrA is an autoinducer in a peptide-quorum two-component regulatory system whose mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis gshF with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: gshF is a bifunctional glutamate-cysteine ligase/ glutathione synthetase that when mutated, confers daptomycin resistance.

name: Escherichia coli AcrAB-TolC with AcrR mutation conferring resistance to ciprofloxacin, tetracycline, and ceftazidime
description: AcrR is a repressor of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrR mutations result in high level antibiotic resistance. The mutations associated with this model are specific to E. coli.

name: carO
description: carO is a transmembrane beta-barrel involved in the influx of carbapenem antibiotics in Acinetobacter baumannii. Disruption of the carO gene by distinct insertion elements results in a loss of carO expression causing resistance to carbapenem antibiotics. Homologs of carO have been identified in genera Acinetobacter, Moraxella and Psychrobacter.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii OprD conferring resistance to imipenem
description: An outer member protein (OMP) found in Acinetobacter baumannii involved in the uptake of imipenem and basic amino acids. This porin is homologous to Pseudomonas aeruginosa OprD, which performs an identical function.

name: adeC
description: AdeC is the outer membrane factor of the AdeABC multidrug efflux complex. It can be replaced by other outer membrane channels, and is not essential for antibiotic resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis drmA with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: drmA is an uncharacterized 6-pass membrane protein, with mutations to the protein causing modest resistance to daptomycin.

name: Enterococcus faecalis YvlB with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: YvlB is a putative target of the liaFSR signalling pathway, whose mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Mutations in the A subunit of DNA gyrase reduce its affinity for fluoroquinolones, thereby conferring resistance.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Mutations in Acinetobacter baumannii parC that result in resistance to fluoroquinolones.

name: mgrB
description: mgrB is a small transmembrane protein produced in the PhoPQ signalling system. It acts as a negative regulator in this system. Inactivation or down-regulation of mgrB confers colistin resistance by absence as shown in Klebsiella pneumoniae.

name: cdeA
description: Clostridioides difficile and Escherichia coli multidrug efflux transporter with antiporter function. Confers resistance to fluoroquinolones in E. coli and acriflavin in Clostridioides difficile.

name: qacH
description: qacH is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump in Staphylococcus saprophyticus.

name: gadW
description: GadW is an AraC-family regulator that promotes mdtEF expression to confer multidrug resistance. GadW inhibits GadX-dependent activation. GadW clearly represses gadX and, in situations where GadX is missing, activates gadA and gadBC.

name: Mrx
description: Mrx is part of the macrolide inactivation gene cluster in Aeromonas hydrophila.

name: kdpE
description: kdpE is a transcriptional activator that is part of the two-component system KdpD/KdpE that is studied for its regulatory role in potassium transport and has been identified as an adaptive regulator involved in the virulence and intracellular survival of pathogenic bacteria. kdpE regulates a range of virulence loci through direct promoter binding.

name: MUS-2
description: MUS-2 is a chromosome-encoded beta-lactamase from Myroides odoratimimus.

name: leuO
description: leuO, a LysR family transcription factor, exists in a wide variety of bacteria of the family Enterobacteriaceae and is involved in the regulation of as yet unidentified genes affecting the stress response and pathogenesis expression. LeuO is also an activator of the MdtNOP efflux pump.

name: mfd
description: mfd dissociates transcription elongation complexes blocked at nonpairing lesions and mediates recruitment of DNA repair proteins. The Mfd (mutation frequency decline) protein, also known as transcription-repair coupling factor, is responsible for ATP-dependent removal of stalled RNA polymerase from DNA lesions by inducing forward movement of the RNA polymerase and subsequent recruitment of nucleotide excision repair machinery to the sites of the lesions.

name: ADC-1
description: ADC-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-2
description: ADC-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Oligella urethralis.

name: ADC-3
description: ADC-3 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-4
description: ADC-4 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-5
description: ADC-5 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-6
description: ADC-6 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-7
description: ADC-7 is a beta-lactamase that is found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-8
description: ADC-8 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter sp.

name: ADC-10
description: ADC-10 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-12
description: ADC-12 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-13
description: ADC-13 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-14
description: ADC-14 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-15
description: ADC-15 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-16
description: ADC-16 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-17
description: ADC-17 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-18
description: ADC-18 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-19
description: ADC-19 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-20
description: ADC-20 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-21
description: ADC-21 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-22
description: ADC-22 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-23
description: ADC-23 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-25
description: ADC-25 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-31
description: ADC-31 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-39
description: ADC-39 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-41
description: ADC-41 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-42
description: ADC-42 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-43
description: ADC-43 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-44
description: ADC-44 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-56
description: ADC-56 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-61
description: ADC-61 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-74
description: ADC-74 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-75
description: ADC-75 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-76
description: ADC-76 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-77
description: ADC-77 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-78
description: ADC-78 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-79
description: ADC-79 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-80
description: ADC-80 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-81
description: ADC-81 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-82
description: ADC-82 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: Escherichia coli GlpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Point mutations to the active importer GlpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: Escherichia coli UhpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mutations to the active importer UhpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: Escherichia coli uhpA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: uhpA is a positive activator of the fosfomycin importer uhpT, thus mutations to uhpA confer fosfomycin resistance by reducing uhpT expression. Both knockout and amino acid substitution mutations have been found that confer resistance, with the Protein Knockout model describing the large, knockout mutations causing loss of function of the gene, and the Protein Variant model describing the amino acid substitutions.

name: Rm3
description: Rm3 is a class B3 metallo-beta-lactamase isolated from a metagenomic soil sample in Yorkshire, United Kingdom, shown to confer resistance to clinically used penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.

name: Pseudomonas mutant PhoP conferring resistance to colistin
description: Mutations in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PhoP of the two-component PhoPQ regulatory system. Presence of mutation confers resistance to colistin.

name: Pseudomonas mutant PhoQ conferring resistance to colistin
description: Mutations in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PhoQ of the two-component PhoPQ regulatory system. Presence of mutation confers resistance to colistin.

name: Escherichia coli PtsI with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: PtsI (phosphoenolpyruvate-protein phosphotransferase) is involved in cyclic AMP synthesis, which regulates glpT expression. As a result, mutations to ptsI confer resistance to fosfomycin by affecting the regulation of fosfomycin import.

name: Escherichia coli cyaA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: CyaA (adenylate cyclase) is involved with the synthesis of cyclic AMP which regulates the fosfomycin transporter glpT. As a result, mutations to cyaA confer resistance to fosfomycin.

name: Staphylococcus aureus GlpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mutations to the active importer GlpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: Staphylococcus aureus UhpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mutations to the active importer UhpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: ANT(4')-Ib
description: Aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase sequence from Staphylococcus aureus plasmid.

name: cipA
description: Cfr-like methyltransferase enzyme conferring resistance to multiple clinically relevant antibiotic classes.

name: Erm(47)
description: Chromosome-encoded gene conferring MLSB resistance. Identified from Helcococcus kunzii.

name: Staphylococcus aureus menA with mutation conferring resistance to lysocin
description: menA encodes a 1,4-dihydroxy-2-naphthoate octaprenyltransferase, with mutations to the protein conferring resistance to lysocin E.

name: apmA
description: Plasmid-borne apramycin-resistant aminocyclitol acetyltransferase gene identified from bovine MRSA.

name: pgpB
description: A gene that produces the protein lipid A 4'-phosphatase.

name: oqxAB
description: oqxAB encodes for OqxAB, a plasmid-encoded efflux pump, which confer resistance to multiple agents including fluoroquinolones.

name: oqxA
description: RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone.

name: oqxB
description: RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone.

name: Haemophilus parainfluenzae gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation of Haemophilus parainfluenzae gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and GyrA. Thus, conferring resistance. Both Ser and Tyr are hydrophilic amino acids, however Tyr has an additional bulky hydrophobic group which could affect the interaction between the DNA gyrase with quinolones.

name: Haemophilus parainfluenzae parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation of Haemophilus parainfluenzae parC resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and ParC. Thus, conferring resistance.

name: Salmonella enterica gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Salmonella gyrA that confer resistance to Nalidixic acid, a fluoroquinolone antibiotic. These mutations have also been shown to reduce susceptibility to ciprofloxacin.

name: Neisseria gonorrhoeae gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in Neisseria gonorrhoeae DNA gyrase subunit A. Decreases affinity between fluoroquinolone antibiotic molecule and gyrA, thereby conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone.

name: Neisseria gonorrhoeae parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Neisseria gonorrhoeae parC protein that confer resistance to fluoroquinolone by reducing affinity to antibiotic binding site.

name: rpsJ
description: rpsJ is a tetracycline resistance protein identified in Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Tetracycline resistance is conferred by binding to the ribosome as a 30S ribosomal protection protein.

name: Capnocytophaga gingivalis gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in Capnocytophaga gingivalis that decreases binding affinity of fluoroquinolone antibiotics to gyrA, thereby conferring resistance.

name: Neisseria meningititis PBP2 conferring resistance to beta-lactam
description: Point mutation in Neisseria meningititis PBP2 (penA) decreases affinity between beta-lactam antibiotic molecule and PBP2, thereby conferring resistance to beta-lactam.

name: Salmonella enterica parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Salmonella parC gene implicated in decreased susceptibility to fluoroquinolone antibiotics, primarily ciprofloxacin and nalidixic acid.

name: Shigella flexneri gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Shigella flexneri gyrA observed to confer resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics.

name: Shigella flexneri parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics in Shigella flexneri,.

name: abcA
description: AbcA is a multidrug resistant ABC transporter that confers resistance to methicillin, daptomycin, cefotaxime, and moenomycin.

name: efrA
description: efrA is a part of the EfrAB efflux pump, and both efrA and efrB are necessary to confer drug resistance.

name: efrB
description: efrB is a part of the EfrAB efflux pump, and both efrA and efrB are necessary to confer multidrug resistance.

name: msbA
description: MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A, a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane, and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.

name: YojI
description: YojI mediates resistance to the peptide antibiotic microcin J25 when it is expressed from a multicopy vector. YojI is capable of pumping out microcin molecules.  The outer membrane protein TolC in addition to YojI is required for export of microcin J25 out of the cell. Microcin J25 is thus the first known substrate for YojI.

name: hmrM
description: hmrM is a multidrug efflux pump belonging to the MATE family and functions as a  Na+/drug antiporter.

name: efmA
description: efmA is an MFS transporter permease in  E. faecium.

name: efpA
description: efpA is an MFS transporter found in Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

name: farA
description: farA is the membrane fusion protein that is part of the farAB efflux pump.

name: farB
description: farB is the cytoplasmic transporter protein that is part of the farAB efflux pump. farB corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.

name: hp1181
description: hp1181 is a translocase that is part of the MFS efflux pump family. It is found in H. pylori and has role in the active efflux of antibiotics.

name: hp1184
description: hp1184 is a translocase that belongs to the MATE efflux pump family. It is found in H. pylori and is involved in the active efflux of antibiotics.

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae OmpK35
description: Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. In beta-lactam-resistant Klebsiella, this porin is often deleted, limiting diffusion of the antibiotic into the cell. Klebsiella strains expressing OmpK35 are often beta-lactam sensitive even in the presence of beta-lactamases because of an inefficient mechanism.

name: lfrA
description: lfrA is involved in the active efflux of quinolones and is found in Mycobacteroides abscessus.

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae OmpK36
description: Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. In beta-lactam-resistant Klebsiella, this porin is often deleted, limiting diffusion of the antibiotic into the cell. Klebsiella strains expressing OmpK36 are often beta-lactam sensitive even in the presence of beta-lactamases because of an inefficient mechanism.

name: lmrP
description: lmrP is a proton motive force-dependent drug transporter that is part of the MFS efflux pump family.

name: D-Ala-D-Ala ligase
description: Non-van ligases that synthesize D-Ala-D-Ala, the default cell wall precursor that makes a cell vulnerable to glycopeptide antibiotics. Mutations in the ddl gene can cause the production of nonfunctional/inactivated D-Ala-D-Ala ligases, which can render bacteria glycopeptide dependent depending on the presence of vancomycin resistance clusters.

name: Erm(44)v
description: Variant of Erm(44)v isolated from Staphylococcus saprophyticus, confers resistance to lincosamide and macrolide antibiotics but not streptogramins.

name: Cutibacterium acnes gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Cutibacterium acnes gyrA protein known to confer resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics.

name: Halobacterium salinarum 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to pactamycin
description: Point mutations in Halobacterium 16S rRNA that confer resistance to pactamycin antibiotic.

name: Chlamydomonas reinhardtii 16S rRNA (rrnS) mutation conferring resistance to streptomycin
description: Point mutation in C. reinhardtii rrnS conferring resistance to streptomycin antibiotic.

name: tetA(58)
description: TetA(58) is a Tetracycline efflux pump described in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: tetB(58)
description: Tetracycline resistant TetB(58) efflux pump found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: LlmA 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase
description: Lincosamide (Clindamycin) resistant (putative) ribosomal methyltransferase related to the RlmK 23S rRNA methyltransferase COG family. Detected in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, an isolated strain of Paenibacillus found in Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: CatU
description: Chloramphenicol acetyltransferase conferring resistance to phenicol antibiotics detected in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, an isolated strain of Paenibacillus from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: BahA
description: Bacitracin amidohydrolase found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, an isolated strain of Paenibacillus from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance by bacitracin inactivation through amidohydrolysis. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: TaeA
description: Pleuromutilin (Tiamulin) ABC efflux pump found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: VatI
description: Streptogramin A acetyltransferase found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: AAC(2')-IIb
description: AAC(2')-IIb is an intrinsic Kasugamycin 2' acetyltransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics, including kasugamycin. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: AAC(6')-34
description: AAC(6')-34 is an aminoglycoside 6'-phosphotransferase found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: vgbC
description: VgbC is a streptogramin B-type lyase found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to streptogramin B-type antibiotics by linearization of the lactone ring on an ester bond, resulting in antibiotic inactivation. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: mphI
description: mphI is a macrolide phosphotransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to macrolide antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: rphB
description: rphB is a rifampin phosphotransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to rifamycin antibiotics, specifically rifampin, through rifampin inactivation. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: cpaA
description: cpaA is a capreomycin acetyltransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, an isolated strain of Paenibacillus in Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to capreomycin, an aminoglycoside antibiotic. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.

name: Clostridioides difficile gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Amino acid substitutions in Clostridioides difficile gyrase subunit A which when present confer functional resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics.

name: tetA(46)
description: tetA(46) is a subunit of tetAB(46), a heterodimeric ABC transporter, that is required for conferring tetracycline resistance in Streptococcus australis isolated from the oral cavity.

name: tetB(46)
description: tetB(46) is a subunit of tetAB(46), a heterodimeric ABC transporter, that is required for conferring tetracycline resistance in Streptococcus australis isolated from the oral cavity.

name: tetA(60)
description: tetA(60) is a subunit of tetAB(60), an ABC transporter that confers resistance to tetracycline and tigercycline identified by screening a human saliva metagenomic library in Escherichia coli, which is required for resistance.

name: tetB(60)
description: tetB(60) is a subunit of tetAB(60), an ABC transporter that confers resistance to tetracycline and tigercycline identified by screening a human saliva metagenomic library in Escherichia coli, which is required for resistance.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa emrE
description: EmrE is a small multidrug transporter that functions as a homodimer and that couples the efflux of small polyaromatic cations from the cell with the import of protons down an electrochemical gradient. Confers resistance to tetraphenylphosphonium, methyl viologen, gentamicin, kanamycin, and neomycin.

name: Escherichia coli emrE
description: Member of the small MDR (multidrug resistance) family of transporters; in Escherichia coli this protein provides resistance against a number of positively charged compounds including ethidium bromide and erythromycin; proton-dependent secondary transporter which exchanges protons for compound translocation.

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae acrA
description: AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB multidrug efflux system that in K. pneumoniae, which is encoded by the acrRAB operon.

name: Enterobacter cloacae acrA
description: AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux system in E. cloacae.

name: Escherichia coli acrA
description: AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux system that in E. coli.

name: Escherichia coli fabI mutations conferring resistance to isoniazid and triclosan
description: fabI is a enoyl-acyl carrier reductase used in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis. The bacterial biocide Triclosan blocks the final reduction step in fatty acid elongation, inhibiting biosynthesis. Point mutations in fabI can confer resistance to Triclosan and Isoniazid.

name: kdpD
description: kdpD is a component of the two-component regulatory system, kdpDE. This system is involved in potassium transport and homeostasis, and has been implicated in virulence factor regulation along with kdpE.

name: MexAB-OprM with prematurely terminated MexR conferring resistance to meropenem and ciprofloxacin
description: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with a prematurely terminated MexR confers resistance to meropenem and ciprofloxacin.

name: Escherichia coli fabG mutations conferring resistance to triclosan
description: fabG is a 3-oxoacyl-acyl carrier protein reductase involved in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis.The bacterial biocide Triclosan blocks the final reduction step in fatty acid elongation, inhibiting biosynthesis. Point mutations in fabG can confer resistance to Triclosan.

name: MexAB-OprM with NalC mutations conferring resistance to aztreonam
description: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with NalC mutations conferring resistance to aztreonam. While efflux gene hyperexpression typically results from mutations in the linked mexR repressor gene, it also occurs independently of mexR mutations in so-called nalC mutants that demonstrate more modest mexAB-oprM expression and, thus, more modest multidrug resistance than do mexR strains.

name: MexAB-OprM with NalD mutations conferring resistance to multiple antibiotics
description: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with a NalD mutation conferring resistance to multiple antibiotics. This NalD mutation was found in multidrug-resistant clinical strains lacking mutations in MexR or NalC.

name: MexAB-OprM with CpxR regulator conferring resistance to ciprofloxacin, ceftazidime, and aztreonam
description: CpxR is directly involved in activation of expression of RND efflux pump MexAB-OprM in P. aeruginosa. CpxR is required to enhance mexAB-oprM expression and drug resistance, in the absence of repressor MexR.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa CpxR
description: CpxR is directly involved in activation of expression of RND efflux pump MexAB-OprM in P. aeruginosa. CpxR is required to enhance mexAB-oprM expression and drug resistance, in the absence of repressor MexR.

name: Escherichia coli CpxR
description: The Escherichia coli CpxR/CpxA system responds to general periplasmic stress and has been used as a model two-component system for transcription regulation in bacteria. CpxR/CpxA system facilitates Salmonella and E. coli resistance to cationic antimicrobial peptides.The CpxR/CpxA system can activate transcription of marRAB operon, thus facilitating multidrug-resistant regulator to enhance expression of TolC-dependent tripartite multidrug transporters.

name: ArmR
description: ArmR, a 53-amino-acid antirepressor, allosterically inhibits MexR dimer-DNA binding by occupying a hydrophobic binding cavity within the center of the MexR dimer. ArmR up-regulation and MexR-ArmR complex formation have previously been shown to upregulate MexAB-OprM.

name: Staphylococcus aureus 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to linezolid
description: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA subunit of the large ribosomal bacterial subunit in Staphylococcus aureus, which confer resistance to linezolid by disrupting antibiotic target binding.

name: Type A NfxB
description: Type A NfxB mutants are four to eight times more resistant to ofloxacin, erythromycin, and new zwitterionic cephems, i.e., cefpirome, cefclidin, cefozopran, and cefoselis, than the parent strain, PAO1. nfxB corresponds to 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: esrC/nfxB) and 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58 (gene name: nfxB).

name: Type B NfxB
description: Type B NfxB mutants are more resistant to tetracycline and chloramphenicol, as well as ofloxacin, erythromycin, and the new zwitterionic cephems, than was PAO1, and they are four to eight times more susceptible to carbenicillin, sulbenicillin, imipenem, panipenem, biapenem, moxalactam, aztreonam, gentamicin, and kanamycin than PAO1. The mutation at the 46th amino acid position is sufficient for overproduction of OprJ and the multidrug resistance. nfxB corresponds to 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: esrC/nfxB) and 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58 (gene name: nfxB).

name: MexCD-OprJ with type A NfxB mutation
description: MexCD–OprJ with type A NfxB phenotype are four to eight times more resistant to ofloxacin, erythromycin, and new zwitterionic cephems, i.e., cefpirome, cefclidin, cefozopran, and cefoselis, than the parent strain, PAO1.

name: MexCD-OprJ with type B NfxB mutation
description: MexCD-OprJ with Type B NfxB mutions are more resistant to tetracycline and chloramphenicol, as well as ofloxacin, erythromycin, and the new zwitterionic cephems, than was PAO1, and they are four to eight times more susceptible to carbenicillin, sulbenicillin, imipenem, panipenem, biapenem, moxalactam, aztreonam, gentamicin, and kanamycin than PAO1.

name: EdeQ
description: EdeQ is an N-acetyltransferase enzyme that confers high-level self-resistance to edeine in Brevibacillus brevis, a natural edeine producer. EdeQ converts active edeine to N-acetyledeine, which is ineffective in vivo.

name: MexEF-OprN with MexT mutation conferring resistance to chloramphenicol, ciprofloxacin, and trimethoprim
description: The MexEF–OprN efflux pump in P. aeruginosa is overexpressed with MexT mutation conferring resistance to chloramphenicol and ciprofloxacin.

name: MexEF-OprN with MexS mutations conferring resistance to chloramphenicol, ciprofloxacin, and trimethoprim
description: The MexEF–OprN efflux pump with MexS mutations conferring resistance to chloramphenicol and ciprofloxacin. The model includes the MexT regulator, as MexS is suggested to inactivate MexT.

name: MvaT
description: MvaT, a global regulator of virulence genes in P. aeruginosa, has also shown to be able to repress the expression of the MexEF-OprN pump.

name: MexEF-OprN with MvaT deletion conferring resistance to chloramphenicol and norfloxacin
description: A deletion of MvaT results in the overexpression of MexEF-OprN conferring resistance to chloramphenicol and norfloxacin.

name: OpmB
description: OpmB is an outer membrane efflux protein in Pseudomonas aeruginosa that shows functional cooperation with MuxABC, to form the efflux pump system MuxABC-OpmB.

name: MuxA
description: MuxA is a membrane fusion protein component of the efflux pump system MuxABC-OpmB in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: MuxB
description: MuxB is one of the two necessary RND components in the Pseudomonas aeruginosa efflux pump system MuxABC-OpmB.

name: MuxC
description: MuxC is one of the two necessary RND components of the MuxABC-OpmB efflux pumps system in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: MuxABC-OpmB
description: MuxABC-OpmB is an RND-type multidrug efflux pump in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. This efflux pump confers resistance to aztreonam, novobiocin, tetracycline, erythromycin, kitasamycin and rokitamycin.

name: PmpM
description: PmpM is a multidrug efflux pump belonging to the MATE family of Pseudomonas aeruginosa. PmpM is an H+ drug antiporter and is the first reported case of an H+ coupled efflux pump in the MATE family. PmpM confers resistance to fluoroquinolones, fradiomycin, benzalkonium chloride, chlorhexidine gluconate, ethidium bromide, tetraphenylphosphonium chloride (TPPCl), and rhodamine 6G.

name: MexAB-OprM with MexR mutations confers resistance to multiple antibiotics
description: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with MexR mutations confers resistance to multiple antibiotics in P. aeruginosa.

name: AcrAD-TolC
description: AcrAD-TolC efflux pump system in E. coli from the resistance-nodulation-division family, was shown to participate in the efflux of aminoglycosides.

name: AcrEF-TolC confers resistance to ciprofloxacin
description: AcrEF-TolC efflux pump system of E. coli confers resistance to fluoroquinolones (ciprofloxacin).

name: lnuG
description: lnuG is a transposon-mediated lincosamide nucleotidyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecalis on Tn6260.

name: APH(3')-VIIIb
description: APH(3')-VIIIb is an aminoglycoside phosphoryltransferase that acts on the 3-OH target of aminoglycosides found in Acinetobacter rudis.

name: APH(3')-IXa
description: APH(3')-IXa is an aminoglycoside phosphoryltransferase that acts on the 3-OH target of aminoglycosides.

name: ANT(3'')-IIa
description: ANT(3'')-IIa is a aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase identified in Acinetobacter spp. via horizontal gene transfer mechanisms.

name: ANT(3'')-IIb
description: ANT(3'')-IIb is a aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase identified in Acinetobacter spp. via horizontal gene transfer mechanisms.

name: ANT(3'')-IIc
description: ANT(3'')-IIc is a aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase identified in Acinetobacter spp. via horizontal gene transfer mechanisms.

name: HMB-1
description: Shotgun cloning of beta-lactam resistant P. aeruginosa NRZ-03096 yielded a clone producing a novel subclass B1 enzyme with only 74.3% identity to the next nearest relative, KHM-1. The novel MBL was named HMB-1 (for Hamburg MBL). HMB-1 gene was chromosomally located as part of a Tn 3 family transposon that was named Tn 6345, where expression of bla HMB-1 in E. coli TOP10 led to increased resistance to beta-lactams.

name: NDM-17
description: NDM-17 is a metallo-beta-lactamase isolated from Escherichia coli with enhanced carbapenemase activity compared to NDM-1.

name: Erm(48)
description: Erm(48) is a macrolide-lincosamide-streptogramin resistance gene identified on resistance plasmid pJW2311.

name: Streptococcus mitis CdsA with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: CdsA is a phosphatidate cytidylyltransferase which plays a role in the production of membrane phosphatidylglycerol and cardiolipin.

name: LpeA
description: LpeA is a subunit of the LpeAB efflux pump in Legionella pneumophila, which is homologous to AcrA in E. coli.

name: LpeB
description: LpeB is a subunit of the LpeAB efflux pump in Legionella pneumophila, which is homologous to AcrB in E. coli.

name: MdtNOP
description: MdtNOP is a MFS efflux pump protein found in E. coli. The deletion of mdtP from strain W3110 resulted in increased susceptibility to acriflavin, puromycin, and tetraphenylarsonium chloride. An E. coli mdtN null mutant is more sensitive to sulfur drugs than wild type.

name: kamB
description: Methyltransferase enzyme first described in Streptoalloteichus tenebrarius. Confers resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics (esp. apramycin) through methylation of the 16S rRNA at A1408, thereby modifying the antibiotic target.

name: QepA2
description: QepA2 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance pump found in an Escherichia coli isolate from France.

name: TMB-1
description: TMB-1 is a TMB metallo-beta-lactamase found in Achromobacter sp.

name: TMB-2
description: TMB-2 is a TMB metallo-beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter sp.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa soxR
description: SoxR is a redox-sensitive transcriptional activator that induces expression of a small regulon that includes the RND efflux pump-encoding operon mexGHI-opmD. SoxR was shown to be activated by pyocyanin.

name: Enterobacter cloacae rob
description: rob is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.

name: Escherichia coli rob
description: rob is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.

name: MCR-2.1
description: MCR-2 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase that interferes with binding of colistin to the cell membrane via addition of phosphoethanolamine to lipid A, resulting in reduction of the negative charge of the cell membrane. Originally identified in a Belgian sample of Escherichia coli by Xavier et al, (2016).

name: FosA6
description: FosA6 is a plasmid-encoded enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.

name: FosA7
description: FosA7 is an enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.

name: porin OmpC
description: In the presence of antibiotic stress, there is a coupled down-regulation of the porin OmpC with the OmpF.  Mutants both lacking both OmpC and OmpF proteins are resistant to cephaloridine and cefazolin. Analyses of genes involved in the increased resistance to tetracycline suggest that the up-regulation of efflux pump genes is accompanied by a decrease of OmpF and OmpC synthesis. Homologs of OmpC have been identified in Escherichia coli, Salmonella enterica, Klebsiella aerogenes and Serratia marcescens.

name: Vibrio cholerae OmpU
description: A ToxR-Regulated outer membrane porin. In Vibrio cholerae, ToxR controls resistance to P2 (a BPI-derived antimicrobial peptide) by regulating the production of OmpU. OmpU also confers resistance to polymyxin B sulfate.

name: Vibrio cholerae OmpT
description: A ToxR negatively regulated outer membrane porin. In Vibrio cholerae, ToxR controls resistance to P2 (a BPI-derived antimicrobial peptide) by regulating the production of OmpT, especially in the absence of OmpU.

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae OmpK37
description: Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36, which did not allow penetration by certain beta-lactams. Also, when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.

name: Burkholderia pseudomallei Omp38
description: Heterologous expression of Burkholderia pseudomallei Omp38 (BpsOmp38) in Omp-deficient E. coli host cells lowers their permeability and in consequence, their antimicrobial susceptibility to penicillin G, cefoxitin, ceftazidime and imipenem.

name: Moraxella catarrhalis M35
description: The outer membrane protein M35 of Moraxella catarrhalis is an antigenically conserved porin. Down-regulation of M35 significantly increases the MICs of aminopenicillins, specifically amoxicillin.

name: Escherichia coli LamB
description: LamB is a negative regulator for antibiotic resistance, it serves as a porin to influx antibiotic. When down-regulated, it increases resistance to chlortetracycline, ciprofloxacin, balofloxacin and nalidixic acid. It also interacts with Odp1, an energy metabolic enzyme, creating a complex that decreases in antibiotic-resistant strains.

name: Escherichia coli mipA
description: MltA-interacting protein (mipA), is an antibiotic resistance-related outer membrane protein. Deletion of mipA increases kanamycin, nalidixic acid and streptomycin resistance.

name: Serratia marcescens Omp1
description: Omp1 is an outer membrane porin that confers resistance by absence in S. marcescens.  Knockout, deletion or other inhibition of the omp1 gene confers resistance to certain beta-lactamase antibiotics - including Cefoxitin, Ceftriaxone, Cefotaxime, and Moxalactam - as well as Ciprofloxacin, Tetracycline, and Chloramphenicol, by preventing passage of the antibiotic into the cell.

name: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to erythromycin and telithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to the macrolide-class antibiotics erythromycin and telithromycin.

name: Chlamydomonas reinhardtii 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to erythromycin
description: Point mutation in 23S rRNA of C. reinhardtii chloroplast shown clinically to confer resistance to Erythromycin, a macrolide antibiotic.

name: Brachyspira hyodysenteriae 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to tylosin
description: Point mutation in B. hyodysenteriae 23S rRNA shown to confer resistance to tylosin and erythromycin.

name: Helicobacter pylori 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutations in Helicobacter pylori shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide antibiotic.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniB with mutation conferring resistance to ethambutol
description: Point mutations in M. tuberculosis iniB shown to confer resistance to ethambutol.

name: Moraxella catarrhalis 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics
description: Point mutations in the 23S ribosomal RNA subunit of M. catarrhalis shown clinically to confer resistance to macrolide class antibiotics.

name: MCR-3.1
description: MCR-3 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase that interferes with binding of colistin to the cell membrane via addition of phosphoethanolamine to lipid A, resulting reduction in negative charge of the cell membrane. Originally described by Yin et al. 2017, from a porcine Escherichia coli plasmid pWJ1.

name: OprZ
description: OprZ is the outer membrane component of the AxyXY-OprZ efflux pump system in Achromobacter spp.

name: AxyX
description: AxyX is the inner membrane transporter of the AxyXY-OprZ efflux pump system in Achromobacter spp.

name: AxyY
description: AxyY is the periplasmic adaptor protein of the AxyXY-OprZ efflux pump system in Achromobacter spp.

name: AxyZ
description: AxyZ is a transcriptional regulator of the AxyXY-OprZ efflux pump system.

name: cfrC
description: A cfr-like 23S rRNA methyltransferase shown to confer resistance to linezolid and phenicol antibiotics, including florfenicol and chloramphenicol, in Clostridium.

name: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clindamycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to clindamycin, a lincosamide antibiotic.

name: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to chloramphenicol
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to chloramphenicol.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis thyA with mutation conferring resistance to para-aminosalicylic acid
description: Point mutations in the thymidylate synthetase thyA gene shown clinically to confer resistance to para-aminosalicylic acid. Loss-of-function mutations in thyA disrupt the catalytic activity and substrate-binding affinity, thus conferring resistance.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis folC with mutation conferring resistance to para-aminosalicylic acid
description: Point mutations in the dihydrofolate synthetase folC gene shown clinically to confer resistance to p-aminosalicylic acid or other aminosalicylates. Mutations in folC inhibit bioactivation of PAS and thus confer resistance.

name: Mycoplasma gallisepticum 23S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics
description: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA (domain V) of Mycoplasma gallisepticum can confer resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics (tiamulin and valnemulin). The mutants also show cross-resistance to lincomycin, chloramphenicol and florfenicol.

name: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide antibiotic.

name: Propionibacteria 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Propionibacteria shown clinically to confer resistance to macrolides.

name: Mycobacteroides abscessus 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycobacteroides abscessus shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.

name: Mycobacterium avium 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycobacterium avium shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.

name: Mycobacteroides chelonae 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycobacteroides chelonae shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.

name: Mycobacterium intracellulare 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycobacterium intracellulare shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.

name: Mycobacterium intracellulare 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to azithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycobaccterium avium shown to confer resistance to azithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.

name: Mycobacterium kansasii 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycobacterium kansasii shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.

name: Mycolicibacterium smegmatis 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycolicibacterium smegmatis shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.

name: Streptococcus pneumoniae 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Streptococcus pneumoniae shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics.

name: Streptomyces ambofaciens 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Streptomyces ambofaciens shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics.

name: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to oxazolidinone antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown to confer resistance to oxazolidinone type antibiotics.

name: Chlamydia trachomatis 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Chlamydia trachomatis shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics.

name: Mycoplasma hominis 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycoplasma hominis shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics.

name: Mycoplasmopsis fermentans 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycoplasmopsis fermentans shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics.

name: Mycoplasma pneumoniae 23S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to erythromycin
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycoplasma pneumoniae shown to confer resistance to erythromycin.

name: Halobacterium halobium 23S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to chloramphenicol
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Halobacterium halobium shown to confer resistance to chloramphenicol.

name: Streptococcus pneumoniae 23S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to macrolides and streptogramins antibiotics
description: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Streptococcus pneumoniae shown to confer resistance to macrolides and streptogramins types of antibiotics.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis ribD with mutation conferring resistance to para-aminosalicylic acid
description: ribD is a Mycobacterium tuberculosis riboflavin biosynthesis enzyme. Point mutations in ribD cause enzyme overexpression, which allows the C-terminal reductase domain to act as an alternative dihydrofolate reductase. Thus, mutations in ribD confer resistance to DHFR inhibitors such as para-aminosalicylic acid.

name: mecD
description: mecD is a PBP2a variant identified on a genomic resistance island in Macrococcus caseolyticus. MecD confers resistance to methicillin and other beta-lactam antibiotics through the production of an alternative low-affinity PBP. First described by Schwendener et al. 2017 and identified from canine and bovine sources.

name: Bla2
description: Bla2 is a chromosomal-encoded beta-lactamase, found in Bacillus anthracis, which has penicillin, cephalosporin, and carbapenem-hydrolizing abilities.

name: APH(2'')-If
description: Aminoglycoside 2''-phosphotransferase identified from the gram-negative pathogen Campylobacter jejuni. APH(2'')-If was shown to confer resistance to 4,6-disubstituted antibiotics kanamycin, tobramycin, dibekacin, gentamicin and sisomicin through antibiotic phosphorylation. Described by Toth et al. 2013.

name: MCR-1.2
description: A plasmid-borne novel MCR-1 functional variant detected in a Klebsiella pneumoniae isolate collected from a rectal swab in Italy. MCR-1.2 differs from MCR-1 by a single amino acid substitution from Glutamine to Leucine at position 3 in the N-terminal region. Described by DiPilato et al. 2016.

name: GOB-18
description: GOB-18 is a member of subclass B3 GOB family of beta-lactamases isolated from Elizabethkingia meningoseptica. GOB-18 is unlike other subclass B3 beta-lactamases as it is fully active against a broad range of beta-lactam substrates using a single Zn(II) ion in its active site.

name: NPS-1
description: NPS-1 is a plasmid-encoded class D beta-lactamases identified from two Pseudomonas aeruginosa isolates in 1986.

name: vanU gene in vanG cluster
description: Also known as vanUG, is a vanG variant found in the vanG gene cluster.

name: vanV gene in vanB cluster
description: Also known as vanVB, is a vanV variant found in the vanB gene cluster. It is found in some but not all vanB operons in E. faecalis, suggesting the existence of varied gene compositions in vanB operons.

name: Vibrio cholerae varG
description: varG is an Ambler class B metallo-beta-lactamase found on the antibiotic resistance var regulon in Vibrio cholerae, along with an antibiotic efflux pump varABCDEF. These genes are organized as a regulon under the control of VarR transcriptional activator. VarG was shown to have beta-lactamase activity against penicillins, carbapenems and cephalosporins in-vitro. Described by Lin HV et al. 2017.

name: Escherichia coli ampC beta-lactamase
description: A class C ampC beta-lactamase (cephalosporinase) enzyme described in Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to penicillin-like and cephalosporin-class antibiotics.

name: Rhodobacter sphaeroides ampC beta-lactamase
description: A periplasmic cephalosporinase described in Rhodobacter sphaeroides shown to contribute to resistance of beta-lactam antibiotics.

name: Laribacter hongkongensis ampC beta-lactamase
description: A chromosome-encoded class C beta-lactamase described in the pathogen Laribacter hongkongensis, often associated with gastroenteritis. Laribacter ampC has been shown to confer resistance to non-carbapenem beta-lactamases, as described by Lau et al. 2005.

name: BUT-1
description: A chromosome-encoded  class C cephalosporinase and penicillinase from Buttiauxella spp. shown clinically to confer resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics. Described by Fihman et al. 2002.

name: MCR-4.1
description: MCR-4 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase variant of MCR-1, isolated from Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium of porcine origin in Italy, Spain and Belgium through 2013 and 2015-2016. MCR-4 confers resistance to collistin via addition of a phosphoethanolamine group to lipid A, reducing the negative charge of the cell membrane. Described by Carattoli et al. 2017.

name: MCR-5.1
description: MCR-5 is a transposon-associated phosphoethanolamine transferase gene, identified in Salmonella Paratyphi B dTa+ (d-tartrate fermenting Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Paratyphi B) isolates from food-producing animals. The isolates were collected between 2011 and 2013, and retrieved from the German National Reference Laboratory for Salmonella. MCR-5 confers resistance to collistin through the addition of a phosphoethanolamine group to lipid A, causing a reduction in negative charge of the cell membrane. Described by Borowiak et al, 2017.

name: Salmonella enterica gyrA with mutation conferring resistance to triclosan
description: Point mutations in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium which have been shown to increase the minimum inhibitory concentration of the antibiotic triclosan. It is hypothesized that decreased susceptibility to triclosan in Salmonella gyrA mutants occurs indirectly due to alterations in the stress response pathways.

name: Escherichia coli gyrA with mutation conferring resistance to triclosan
description: Point mutations in Escherichia coli which have been shown to increase the minimum inhibitory concentration of the antibiotic triclosan. It is hypothesized that decreased susceptibility to triclosan in E. coli gyrA mutants occurs indirectly due to alterations in the stress response pathways.

name: PDC-73
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-74
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-75
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-76
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-77
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-78
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-79
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-80
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-81
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-82
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-83
